Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the CASPER Stent in Carotid Artery Stenting

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Participants.evidence: Eligible patients had ≥50% symptomatic or ≥80% asymptomatic stenosis.

Intervention.evidence: A total of 140 patients underwent carotid artery stenting with the CASPER stent.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate its safety and effectiveness in patients at high or normal risk for carotid endarterectomy (CEA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the absence of major adverse events (MAEs) within 30 days and ipsilateral stroke within 1 year.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 140 patients underwent carotid artery stenting with the CASPER stent.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The non-MAE rate was 98.6% (95% CI 94.4% to 99.6%), surpassing the performance goal.

Harms.evidence: The MAE rate was 1.4%, with two strokes reported.
